intro: Dorstenia dionga, commonly known as the African mountain star, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a perennial shrub native to tropical Africa, particularly found in regions with high altitudes and humid climates. The plant is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are often palmately lobed and can vary in size depending on environmental conditions. Dorstenia dionga is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
